page.title: 05Harperley Hall.
page.content: Harperley Hall is a Georgian Manor which has been owned by a number of wealthy families until, in 1946 it was bought by the Durham Police Authority. It is used for a variety of reasons but the grounds are kept for the stabling of the Durham police force mounted section and for the training of the police dog section. The actual building is used for the various courses that police officers are required to attend whilst they are still training and for introducing new methods which are introduced from time to time. Until recently visits could be arranged but it si preferred if any visit is by the horses and dogs to the schools or by visiting the local police station under the watchful eye of each schools own community police officer.
